channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Open bin gate, 21st August
item.description:
The gate enclosing Devonshire Hall’s bin area has been left open by the bin men for over a year. I find it baffling that they just don’t care closing it as it was clearly built for a reason. The open gate is a security issue.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lyme Grove, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Inverness Mews, junction with Queensway - stickering on reverse of signage column., 21st August
item.description:
Please remove.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Inverness Place, Bayswater, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing bin, 21st August
item.description:
This bin is again overflowing making for an appalling view. Hundreds of passers by have to endure this several times a day. Not to mention for being unsanitary and polluting the river. Greenwich council please run a tighter bin collection service during summer times.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Erebus Drive, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: LBB shrub beds overhanging pavement, 21st August
item.description:
Shrub beds have not been cut this year and are starting to obstruct pavement passing. They start alongside 56 Cowden and along the alleyway by 62-70 Cowden Road. They are the responsibility of LBB.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cowden Road, Crofton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish bags and cardboard boxes dumped outside Chalfont court, 21st August
item.description:
There are rubbish bags and cardboard boxes dumped outside Chalfont court on AllSop place. The bags are blocking the pavement

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Allsop Place, Marylebone, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street Light missing, 21st August
item.description:
Following damage, the lamp post has been removed entirely. This means that the alleyway running alongside no12-16 Fordwich is extremely dark and this area is for over 55's housing. Also the light at the other end of the alley near no12 is covered by the tree branches so does not provide hardly any light. Please can this also be rectified.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mayfield Avenue, Crofton, London
Report on FixMyStreet
